title: Pointers Introduction
subject: C Programming
theory:
Variable that stores address of another variable. 
Power of C. Direct memory access. 
- `&var`: Gives address. 
- `*ptr`: Gives value at address.

common_mistakes.correction: Wild Pointer. Points to random memory. Accessing causes crash. Always init to NULL.

interview_questions.question: Size of pointer?
interview_questions.answer: Always same for architecture (4 bytes on 32-bit, 8 on 64-bit), regardless of type (int*, char*).

exam_notes: * is used in declaration (int *p) AND dereference (*p = 5). Context matters.
